body:
Hello Varma,


If you install Daysim 4.0 and the new DAYSIMps tool addition, you can open  
the Java-based interface with the command,
> java -jar c:\DAYSIM\bin\DAYSIMps.jar
I wouldn't recommend trying to use the woefully outdated version 3.1  
installer personally.


As for the Ecotect problems, Ecotect should be compatible with Daysim 4.0  
as the header file format is largely unchanged and should be backwards  
compatible. I would recommend to see if you can find the location of  
Ecotect's Daysim batch file and appending "PAUSE" to the end of it in  
order to see the error message. We might be able to help more seeing that  
output.


Sadly it does sound like an Ecotect issue interfacing with Daysim. Perhaps  
Autodesk's support could also be helpful in this situation?


Best regards,
Alstan




On Wed, 02 Jul 2014 12:03:29 -0400, hara kumar varma namburu
___
